subsc: Central government administration,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's outcome was
            satisfactory. However, its cost-effectiveness in achieving
            project objectives was considered highly satisfactory. The
            key lessons learned are: 1) Proper economic and sector work
            should be carried out on a regular basis. 2) It is important
            to have the closest possible participation of
            representatives of the different sub-sectors in
            identification and design. 3) Early discussions with, and
            full involvement of, key parts of the executive branch of
            the Government in project identification and preparation are
            important. 4)The Bank must take a firm stand on key issues,
            particularly at appraisal and negotiations, and the
            Government should do the same. 5) A project start-up seminar
            and the preparation of an Operational Manual would have
            helped to minimize some of the issues encountered in the
            early years of the project. 6) The project's design
            should include a project coordinating unit. 7) The project
            shows that good project design must be accompanied by a
            stable macro-economic and sector policy environment, and
            that policy intervention should be carefully tailored to
            relatively simple objectives. 8) It is right to open up the
            retailing of credit to the whole financial sector and to
            make investment resources available. 9) Timely strengthening
            of institutions and a good legal basis are important in
            institutional development. 10) It is important to define
            closely during appraisal the precise accounting system to
            record project expenditures.
